verses.verse: Before the Passover festival, Jesus knew that his hour had come that he should leave this world for the Father. He loved his own who were in the world; he loved them to the utmost.
With supper finished, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him,
[and] Jesus knowing that the Father had given everything into his hands and that he had come from God and was returning to God,
got up from supper and laid aside his outer garments, took a towel, and tied it around himself.
After that he poured water into a washbasin and began to wash the disciples' feet and to dry them with the towel that was tied around him.
Then he came to Simon Peter, who said to him, "Lord, are you going to wash my feet?"
Jesus answered and said to him, "What I do, you do not understand just now, but you will understand later."
Peter said to him, "You will never wash my feet." Jesus answered him, "If I don't wash you, you have no part with me."
Simon Peter said to him, Lord, not just my feet but also my hands and head."
Jesus said to him, "The one who is washed only needs to wash his feet and is completely clean. You are clean but not all."
He knew who was going to betray him, that's why he said, "You are not all clean.'
Then after he had washed their feet, had retaken his outer robe, and had sat down again, he said to them, "Do you understand what I have done to you?
"You call me Teacher and Lord, and you speak truly, for so I am.
"If I, Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also must wash one another's feet.
"I have given you an example, so that you must do what I have done to you.
Very truly, I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master, neither the one who is sent greater than the one who sent him.
"If you know these things, how happy you are, if you do them.
"I'm not talking about all of you; I know whom I picked out, but it was so Scripture might be fulfilled, «He who eats bread with me has lifted his heel against me.»
"I tell you this now before it happens, so that when it does happen you may believe that I AM.
"Very truly, I say to you, «The one who receives whomever I send receives me, and the one who receives me receives him who sent me.»
After this Jesus' spirit was distressed and he testified and said, "Very truly, I say to you that one of you will betray me."
Then the disciples looked at one another at a loss to know who he was talking about.
One of his disciples, who Jesus loved, was reclining at Jesus' side.
So Simon Peter motioned to him to ask who he was talking about.
Getting closer to Jesus' side, he said to him, "Lord, who is it?"
Jesus answered, "It is the one to whom I will give a piece of bread after I dip it." After he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, Simon's son.
After taking the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said, "What you do, do quickly."
None of those reclining knew why he said this to him.
For some thought that since Judas had the moneybag that Jesus said to him to buy what they needed for the festival or to give something to the poor.
Then he who received the piece of bread immediately went out, and it was night.
Then as soon as he had left, Jesus said, "Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
"If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself and will immediately glorify him.
"Little children, I am with you only a little while longer. You will look for me, and as I said to the Jews, «Where I am going, you are cannot come,» so I now say to you, too.
"I give you a new commandment that you love one another; just as I have loved you, so you must also love one another.
"In this, all will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another."
Simon Peter said to him, "Lord, where are you going?" Jesus answered him, "Where I am going, you cannot follow me now, but you will follow me later."
"Lord, why can't I follow you now," said Peter. "I will lay down my life for you."
Jesus answered him, "Will you lay down your life for me? Very truly, I say to you the rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times."
